Daxingshan Temple in Jinggongfang.

The Udayana image.

An old object from the Sui Dynasty.

To the south of the east corridor is the abbot's residence.
In the courtyard there are four blue catalpa trees.
Planted by Su himself.
In the Yuanhe period, many officials and nobles visited this residence.
The catalpa trees sweat in summer.
Soiling people's clothes like a sweatbox.
The fat cannot be washed off.
The image of a clam on the left.
The old legend says:
The Sui Emperor loved clams.
Whenever he ate, he would always have clams as a delicacy.
The number exceeded several tens of thousands.
Suddenly there was one clam.
It was pushed and hit like the others.
The emperor found it strange and placed it on a table.
During the night there was light.
In the morning, the meat naturally fell off.
Inside there was an image of one Buddha and two bodhisattvas.
The emperor was sorrowful and remorseful, and vowed not to eat clams again.
Not Emperor Xuan of Chen - a jade image from Khotan.
17 inches tall and over 1 inch wide.
One Buddha and four bodhisattvas.
One flying immortal, one piece of jade.
Cut the fat, no blemish.
The oily color is like a drop.
Heavenly King's Pavilion.
Built during the Changqing period.
Originally inside the Spring and Brightness Gate.
Connected to the southern palace by a wall.
Its size is the largest in the world.
In the second year of Taihe, the emperor ordered it to be moved to this temple.
When it was dismantled, inside the abdomen.

Now the images of the ghosts and spirits of the tribes have fallen and been destroyed.

Zhao Jinggong Temple in Changlefang was established in the third year of the Kaihuang era of the Sui Dynasty.
Its original name was Hongshan Temple.
In the eighteenth year, it was changed.
On the east wall inside the three gates in the south,
Wu Daozhao painted a picture of the hells in white.
The brushwork is vigorous and angry.
The appearance is gloomy and strange.
Seeing it, one cannot help but feel their hair stand on end.
The place where Wu's painting is most successful is
in the western corridor of the three-storied courtyard.
Fan Changshou painted the Western Paradise and the sixteen pairs of treasures in the jeweled pond.
The pond is especially wonderful.
Look at it carefully.
You will feel the water is deep.
On the gate of the wall courtyard,
there are white-painted trees and rocks.
They are somewhat similar to Yan Lide.
I brought Yan Lide's copy of the Xingtian poem.
Examining it, there is no difference.
Inside the three gates in the west, south of the gate,
Wu Sheng painted a dragon.
And brushed the beard of the Heavenly King.
The brushwork is like iron.
There is a heavenly maiden holding an incense burner.
Stealing glances, wanting to speak.
In the Huayan courtyard, there is a six-foot-tall standing image of Vairocana made of brass.
The ancient style is exquisite and skillful.
Under the pagoda, there were three dou and four sheng of relics.
When the pagoda was moved,
Seng Shouxing established a ritual arena and took out the relics.
He allowed the monks and laypeople to see them.
Before the chanting and praises were finished,
Relics appeared all over the ground.
The monks and laypeople did not dare to step on them.
They all came out of the temple.
Shou Gong then made small clay pagodas and wooden pagodas,
Nearly 100,000 in number, and buried them.
There are still several tens of thousands remaining.
The temple has more than 600 small silver statues,
And one golden Buddha statue several feet tall.
The largest silver statue is over six feet tall.
The ancient style is exquisite.
There is also a small folding screen with the Sutra of the Multitude of Jewels in many hearts,
Stored in a jeweled casket.
On top are multicolored beads and white beads,
Crowded together, confusing the eyes.
During the chaos of Lushan,
Officials hid them in this temple.
The folding screen has 15 sheets with 30 lines.

The initiator, Sima Heng,
Wishing to become the pillar state of the lord, with precious peace and submission.
The pillar state of true virtue.
For the sentient beings of the Dharma realm, he created golden-leafed scriptures.

The Record of What Was Said by Looking Around.
In the Taihe period, it was cut down for the construction of the palace.
Baoying Temple in Daozhengfang, Han Gan.
A person from Lantian.
When he was young, he often delivered wine for a wine shop.
Wang Youcheng's brothers had not yet met.
Every time he got drunk and wandered around.
Han Gan always collected debts from the Wang family.
He playfully drew people and horses on the ground.
Youcheng was skilled in painting.
He found it interesting and completed it.
He was given 20,000 coins.
He was ordered to study painting for more than ten years.

Wu Dao Xuan painted the transformation of the verses on the Abhidharma-koÅ›a.

On the east wall of the trough inside the Buddha hall.
The transformation of Vimalakirti.

At the end of the Yuanhe period.
The monk Wen Shu, who lectured on secular matters, decorated it.
The brushwork is completely exhausted.
The temple's layout has the bell tower in the east.
Only this temple, due to the residence of Li Youzuo Lin Fu being in the east,
thus built the bell tower in the west.
Inside the temple, there is Guo Ling's tortoise shell whip,
and Guo Ling Wang Fu Ren's seven-treasure curtain.
The abbot Yuan Jing has much knowledge of the Buddhist gate.
The story says:
Every time Li Youzuo's birthday arrives,
he always invites the monks of this temple,
to set up a vegetarian feast at his residence.
There was a monk named Yi who once sighed in praise of the Buddha,
and offered a saddle set.
When sold, it was worth 70,000 cash.
Moreover, monk Guang had a reputation,
and recited the sutras for several years.
Next, he was to sigh in praise of the Buddha,
and thus fully observed the right seat's merits,
hoping to obtain generous offerings.
After the vegetarian feast, he came out from under the curtain with a colorful box containing fragrant silk and a piece of cloth, but there was nothing inside.
It was like a rotten nail, a few inches long.
The monk returned disappointed and ashamed.
For several days, he pondered over it.
He thought, A great minister would not deceive me.
So he took it to the western market,
and showed it to a merchant from India.
The Indian merchant was startled and said,
How did the Venerable One obtain this object?
If you want to sell it, I will not go against the price.
The monk tried to sell it for a hundred thousand.
The Indian merchant laughed and said,
Not yet.
Speak with utmost sincerity.
He increased it to five hundred thousand.
The Indian merchant said,
This is worth ten million.
So he gave it to him.
The monk asked its name.
It was said to be a precious bone.
Also, the temple had a monk before,
whose name and surname were not mentioned.
He always carried a bundle on his back,
sitting and lying in the two corridors of the temple.
He was unwilling to stay in the temple.
It lasted for several years.
The temple's chief administrator sometimes advised him to stay in a room,
saying, Do you dislike me?
That night, he burned his body with the bundle.
By the next morning, there was only ash and embers.
There was no foul smell of blood and fat.
The crowd then knew he was an extraordinary person.
They finally made an image out of the ashes.
It is now in the Buddha Hall.
The world called him the Grass-Binding Master.
Guangzhai Fang Guangzhai Temple - Puxian Hall, originally the Heavenly Empress's Combing and Washing Hall.

On the west wall, pressing against it, it is still there.

Zisheng Temple in Chongsheng Fang, outside the gate of the Pure Land Courtyard.
It is said that Wu Sheng once held a candle and painted while drunk.
When looking at it with a spear-like hand, it was terrifying.
Inside the courtyard gate, Lu Lengjia always studied Wu's style.
Wu also taught him hand techniques.
Then he painted the three gates of Samantabhadra Temple, which was half done.
Wu greatly admired him.
He said to people:
Lengjia did not obtain the secret of the mind.
Using too much thought, can he last long?
After the painting was finished, he died.
Cien Temple, the temple was originally the old monastery of Jingjiao and was built by him.

There are 1,897 rooms in total.
